title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:03  has quit 00:21  has joined #xwiki 01:01  has joined #xwiki 01:07  has quit 01:17  has quit 01:33  has joined #xwiki 02:26  has quit 03:15  has quit 04:44  has joined #xwiki 04:45  has quit 05:55  has quit 06:02  has quit 06:09  has joined #xwiki 08:27  has joined #xwiki 09:44  has joined #xwiki 10:06  has joined #xwiki 10:09  has quit 11:04  has joined #xwiki 11:14  has quit 12:38 <+tmortagne> do we plan to release 1.6.1 ? 12:39 <+tmortagne> i can see there is a lot of bugfixes in it 12:48 <@sdumitriu> Same for 2.5.2 12:49 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I think you mean 2.6.1, not 1.6.1, right? 12:49 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yep 2.6.1 12:50 <+tmortagne> well 2.5.2 contains a lot less bugfixes and is very old now so i guess we will never release it but it would be a shame for 2.6.1 12:50 <@sdumitriu> Not so sure, we have a lot more 2.5 instances than 2.6 12:51 <+tmortagne> in any case we will not release 2.5.2 without 2.6.1 12:52 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: XAWM-128 12:53 <@sdumitriu> The right way of escaping is to double the quotes 12:53 <@sdumitriu> As in #set ($MSG\_ERROR\_WIKIALREADYEXISTS = "
$msg.get('error'): $msg.get('wikimanager.wikiname.error.wikialreadyexists')
") 12:53 <@sdumitriu> Just FYI for the future, using single quotes is as good 12:54 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: ok is it new 1.7 thing or always been like that ? 12:54 <@sdumitriu> I think it's almost new 12:54 <+tmortagne> ok 12:54 <@sdumitriu> It was somewhat implemented but broken 13:32  has joined #xwiki 13:40  has joined #xwiki 13:47  has joined #xwiki 14:02  has quit 14:03  has joined #xwiki 15:04  has joined #xwiki 17:17 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: I would really love to have a component to fulfill the role of the skin extension 17:18 <+lucaa> it would make my code much much more elegant 17:18 <+lucaa> and it would allow me to mock it so that I can easily test my stuff 17:18 <+lucaa> (well, easier mock it) 17:19 <+lucaa> I was thinking to make a wrapper for my own code (macros), but then I thought it would be nice to make this wrapper a bit more generic 17:19 <+lucaa> is there an ETA for transforming the SkinExtensionPlugin into a component? 17:21 <+lucaa> wdyt about writing a component that only delegates to the plugin. I was thinking to basically put the 2 "use" methods in an interface (SkinExtension), and then implement it with the ssx, ssfx, ssrx, jsx, jsrx, jsfx hints 17:29 <+lucaa> (I would do it, I was only wondering what do you think about this approach) 18:01  has joined #xwiki 18:09  has quit 19:50  has quit 19:50  has joined #xwiki 19:54  has quit 19:54  has joined #xwiki 19:54  has joined #xwiki 19:59  has quit 20:05  has quit 20:41  has joined #xwiki 21:53  has quit 21:56  has joined #xwiki 21:56  has quit 22:06  has joined #xwiki 22:09  has quit 22:09  is now known as 23:26  has quit 23:40  has quit 23:43  has joined #xwiki
